briefTitle: A Long-Term Safety Study of Org 50081 (Esmirtazapine) in Elderly Outpatients With Chronic Primary Insomnia (176005/P05697/MK-8265-001)
conditions: Sleep Initiation and Maintenance Disorder; Elderly

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Experience at Least One Adverse Event (AE)
outcomeMeasures.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to the study drug.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Discontinue Study Drug Due to an AE
outcomeMeasures.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of study drug, whether or not related to the study drug.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Alertness at Awakening
outcomeMeasures.description: Alertness at awakening was assessed by participants using a 0-100 mm visual analog scale (VAS) in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 6 "How did you feel upon awakening over the past 7 days?". Scores could range from 0=Tired to 100=Alert. Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using an observed cases (OC) approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Feeling Full of Energy
outcomeMeasures.description: Feeling full of energy was assessed by participants using a 0-100 mm visual analog scale (VAS) in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 7 "How full of energy have you felt over the past 7 days?". Scores could range from 0=Terribly tired to 100=Full of energy. Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using an OC approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Ability to Work/Function
outcomeMeasures.description: Ability to work/function was assessed by participants using a 0-100 mm visual analog scale (VAS) in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 8 "How were you able to work or function over the past 7 days?". Scores could range from 0=Not at all to 100=Very well. Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using an OC approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Total Nap Time
outcomeMeasures.description: Total nap time was assessed by participants in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 9a "How much time per day did you nap, on average?". Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using an OC approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Total Sleep Time (TST)
outcomeMeasures.description: TST was defined as the time recorded by participants in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 4 "During the past 7 nights, how much time did you actually spend sleeping, on average?". Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using a last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Wake Time After Sleep Onset (WASO)
outcomeMeasures.description: WASO was defined as the time recorded by participants in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 4 "During the past 7 nights, how much time were you awake, on average, after falling asleep initially?" Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using a LOCF approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Sleep Latency (SL)
outcomeMeasures.description: SL was defined as the time recorded by participants in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 4 "During the past 7 nights, how long did it take you to fall asleep, on average?" Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using a LOCF approach.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Number of Awakenings (NAW)
outcomeMeasures.description: NAW was defined as the time recorded by participants in response to Weekly Sleep Diary question 2a "During the past 7 nights, how many times did you wake up, on average?" Baseline was defined as the Day 1 assessment of Days -7 to 1 before any study drug was taken. Change from Baseline was calculated using a LOCF approach.
